definition: saddle point (math.), a critical point of a function of several variables that is neither a maximum nor a minimum

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: But the saddle point in the imaginary plane should convolute here.
sentences.chinese: 但是在虚拟平面上的鞍点应该环绕这里。

sentences.english: And enlarge the application of the generalized saddle point .
sentences.chinese: 并且拓广了广义鞍点的应用。

sentences.english: Super efficient point in vector optimization problems with set-valued maps characterized by generalized saddle point;
sentences.chinese: 本文研究集值优化问题严有效解的广义鞍点刻画问题。

sentences.english: In three-dimensions it could even be a saddle point.
sentences.chinese: 在三维空间的时候，这个甚至可以是鞍点。

sentences.english: Moreover, we develop corresponding duality theory and related saddle point theory.
sentences.chinese: 同时，我们还建立了对偶理论及相关的鞍点理论。

sentences.english: By using the properties of generalized saddle points and a separation theorem, a property of generalized saddle points is proved with set separation.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究集值优化问题严有效解的广义鞍点刻画问题。

pinyin: zui4 da4 si4 ran2 gu1 ji4

definition: (math.) an analytic function (of a complex variable)
